What is Specificity?

If there are two or more CSS rules that point to the same 
element, the selector with the highest specificity will "win", and its 
style declaration will be applied to that HTML element.

Think of specificity as a hierarchy that determines which style declaration 
is ultimately applied to an element.

content.text: Specificity Hierarchy
Every CSS selector has a position in the specificity hierarchy.

data: Highest priority, directly applied with the style attribute

Second highest priority, identified by the unique id attribute of an 
    element
Third highest priority, targeted using class names
Lowest priority, applies to HTML elements and pseudo-elements
